background: Subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction of droughts and floods is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction. Recent studies suggest that the springtime land surface temperature/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) over the Tibetan Plateau (TP) can be a new source of S2S predictability. The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Sea surface temperature (SST) variations such as those associated with the Madden-Julian Oscillations are known to provide a predictability source. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.

The background temperature gradient at midlatitudes also affects the activity of baroclinic eddies (Xue et al., 2023), which can further reinforce the zonal wind changes and further influence the zonal wind downstream as the eddies move downstream and interact with the zonal flow. The response of the zonal wind in the downstream of TP is consistent with these studies, exhibiting a significant deceleration of the zonal wind along the jet core over the North Pacific. Meanwhile, a significant acceleration of the zonal wind is found to the north of the jet core, indicating a slight northward shift of the jet stream. Such changes in the zonal wind have their counterparts in the observations (see Fig. 4b). One salient feature in Fig. 5a is the strong negative geopotential height anomaly over the TP at 200 hPa, accompanied with a cyclonic anomalous circulation. Such a circulation response corresponds to the cold anomaly over the TP, where the atmosphere sinks and induces negative potential height anomalies at upper levels. Furthermore, evident wave-like patterns downstream from the TP to the North Pacific are shown in the geopotential height difference in Fig. 5a. The negative center of geopotential height anomaly over the TP extends eastward to Japan, while a strong positive geopotential height center with anticyclonic circulation flow emerges to the east over the Bering Strait with a center around 170°E, 50°N. The wave-like geopotential height differences further extend from the Rocky Mountain across the North American continent, North Atlantic Ocean, and back to the Eurasian continent. The above simulated response in atmospheric circulations is in general consistent with the observed geopotential height anomalies in May 2003 (Fig. 5b). In addition, responses in the geopotential height to the cold TP surface are also noticed in the Southern Hemisphere, especially in the midlatitudes (Fig. 5a, b). The WAF is parallel to the group velocity of Rossby waves and can approximately indicate the wave energy propagation.

Although the teleconnections caused by the heating due to oceanic temperature anomalies, such as those between ENSO and the Asian monsoons, have been extensively investigated (e.g., Wang et al. 2000; Li et al. 2007; Li et al. 2017), the remote effects of mountain heating on global atmospheric circulations have not been fully studied. The LS4P-I experiment provides a chance to explore the detailed features of the TRC wave train as well as the global response of atmospheric circulations to the TP surface anomaly. It is well known and extensively studied that the TP surface thermal state can significantly influence the weather and climate in East Asia (e.g. Liu et al. 2020). Earlier studies have shown that, in summertime, there exists a circumglobal teleconnection pattern (CTP) in the extra-tropics of the Northern Hemisphere along the westerly jet. The latent heat with the strong convective monsoon precipitation is suggested a major driver for the CTP (e.g. Lau and Peng 1991; Lau and Weng 2002; Lau et al. 2004 ; Ding and Wang 2005; Ding et al. 2011).
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment. More dynamical understanding of the TRC wave train as well as its cross-equator propagation into the Southern Hemisphere will be explored in the newly launched LS4P phase II experiment.

This study has investigated the mechanisms of the global atmospheric response to the TP spring LST/SUBT anomalies in simulations by LS4P-I ESMs. To further explore the TP’s role and the influence of TRC wave train in S2S predictions, we check the response simulated by each model in May. These results taken together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations.
Our aim is to place the TP LST/SUBT’s influence on the global atmospheric circulations with a focus on the dynamical feature of the TRC wave train and its importance for improving S2S prediction.

However, over the regions from the North Atlantic to the Ural Mountains, the observed geopotential height anomalies show opposite signs to the multi-model average, suggesting that in those regions the TP surface cooling may not be the major cause for the observed circulation anomalies. Compared with the observation, none of the LS4P-I ESMs well captures the observed T2m cold anomaly in May 2003. The ensemble mean of the 16 LS4P-I ESMs exhibits a warm bias of 1.02 °C over the TP, which is stronger than the standard deviation of the observed inter-annual variation of TP T2m (about 0.7 °C). The spatial distribution of the model bias for the ensemble mean is shown in Fig. 1b, which shows a clear warm bias in May 2003 T2m over the eastern part of the TP. The LS4P-I simulations further show that the TP surface thermal state not only has circumglobal influence in the Northern Hemisphere, but it also affects the extratropical atmospheric circulation in the Southern Hemisphere, though with a large uncertainty due to inter-model variability.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The ensemble mean of simulated 200 hPa geopotential height difference is also illustrated in Fig. 5a together with the observations for May 2003 (Fig. 5b), to further explore the atmospheric circulation responses to the TP LST/SUBT effect.

The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. All data are provided at 0.5° × 0.5° spatial resolution. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis (Harris et al. 2014; 2020).
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. The TRC wave train modulated by the TP thermal anomaly play a critical role on the early summer surface air temperature and precipitation anomalies in the regions along the wave train, especially over the northwest North America and the southern Great Plains. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned.

These results taking together suggest that the TRC wave train plays a key role in the influence of TP’s surface and subsurface temperatures on the hot spot regions, especially for the regions in North America, though the detailed mechanisms through which the TRC wave train affects the precipitation in these different regions still need further investigations. The ensemble model simulations show that, with the strong westerly jet across the extratropical Asian-Pacific region, the TP surface cooling generates a barotropic, persistent (evolving in time scales longer than a month) TRC wave train from TP through northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the west part of the North America, whose features closely resemble the observed geopotential height anomaly from May to June in 2003.

The key features of the simulated ensemble mean of June precipitation in response to the TP LST/SUBT effect were discussed in Xue et al. (2022). The LS4P-I experiment, however, shows that the TP surface anomaly can result in persistent and global scale anomalies in atmospheric circulations, and has a near-global influence on the summer T2m and precipitation on S2S time scale. Furthermore, the LS4P-I experiment confirms and highlights the important even critical role of the TRC wave train in the global influence of the TP surface anomaly. The analysis of 16 state-of-the-art ESMs shows for the first time that the springtime TP surface anomaly can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic TRC wave train.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）预测干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的主要挑战之一。最近的研究表明，春季青藏高原（TP）的地表温度/地下温度（LST/SUBT）可以成为S2S预测的新来源。成功预测亚季节到季节（S2S）时间尺度上的干旱和洪水是天气和气候预测中的一大挑战，预测失败可能对社会和经济造成重大不利影响。海表温度（SST）变化，例如与麦登-朱利安振荡相关的变化，已知提供了预测的来源。最近的研究表明，春季地表/地下温度（LST/SUBT）在S2S时间尺度上提供了新的可预测性来源。全球能源与水循环交换（GEWEX）计划已启动“初始化地表温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测影响（LS4P）”项目，以研究春季LST/SUBT异常对夏季降水预测的影响。

中纬度的背景温度梯度也影响了斜压涡旋的活动（Xue et al., 2023），这进一步增强了纬向风的变化，并影响了涡旋向下游移动时与纬向流的相互作用。青藏 Plateau（TP）下游的纬向风响应与这些研究一致，表现为北太平洋喷流核心沿线的纬向风显著减速。同时，在喷流核心北侧发现纬向风显著加速，表明喷流略微向北偏移。这种纬向风的变化在观测中也有对应（见图4b）。图5a中的一个显著特征是TP上方200 hPa的强负位势高度异常，伴随着气旋异常环流。这种环流响应与TP上方的冷异常相对应，气氛下沉并在上层诱导负位势高度异常。此外，从TP向北太平洋下游明显显示出波状模式的位势高度差（见图5a）。TP上方的负位势高度异常中心向东延伸至日本，而在白令海峡东侧出现了一个强正位势高度中心，伴随反气旋环流，中心位于170°E，50°N。波状位势高度差进一步从落基山脉延伸穿过北美大陆、北大西洋，回到欧亚大陆。上述模拟的气候环流响应总体上与2003年5月的观测位势高度异常一致（见图5b）。此外，在南半球，尤其是中纬度地区，也注意到对冷TP表面的位势高度响应（见图5a，b）。因此，我们还检查了模拟风场的异常流函数。波动能量通量（WAF）与罗斯贝波的群速度平行，并可以大致指示波能量的传播。

尽管由于海洋温度异常引起的热带遥相关（如ENSO与亚洲季风之间的关系）已被广泛研究（例如，Wang等，2000；Li等，2007；Li等，2017），但山地加热对全球大气环流的远程影响尚未得到充分研究。LS4P-I实验提供了一个机会，以探索热带高原（TP）表面异常对大气环流的详细特征及其全球响应。众所周知，TP表面的热状态可以显著影响东亚的天气和气候（例如，Liu等，2020）。早期研究表明，在夏季，北半球的副热带地区沿着西风急流存在一个环全球遥相关模式（CTP）。强对流季风降水所带来的潜热被认为是CTP的主要驱动因素（例如，Lau和Peng，1991；Lau和Weng，2002；Lau等，2004；Ding和Wang，2005；Ding等，2011）。
research objectiveCn: 项目“初始化陆地表面温度和雪盖对季节内到季节预测的影响（LS4P）”旨在研究春季陆地表面温度/雪盖异常对高山地区夏季降水预测的影响。目前的工作探讨了16个参与LS4P第一阶段（LS4P-I）实验的当前先进地球系统模型（ESMs）对春季天山地区陆地表面降温的全球尺度大气环流响应的模拟。对热带环流波列及其向南半球的跨赤道传播的动态理解将在新启动的LS4P第二阶段实验中进行深入探讨。
本研究调查了LS4P-I ESMs模拟中全球大气对青藏 Plateau（TP）春季地表温度/地下温度异常的响应机制。为了进一步探讨TP的作用及热带环流（TRC）波列在短期到季节预测中的影响，我们检查了每个模型在五月的响应。这些结果表明，TRC波列在TP的地表和地下温度对热点区域的影响中发挥了关键作用，尤其是在北美地区，尽管TRC波列影响这些不同区域降水的具体机制仍需进一步研究。

background: Subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) precipitation prediction in boreal spring and summer months, despite including large number of high-impact events, such as droughts/floods, has remained poor for years. Tibetan Plateau (TP) spring observed surface temperatures show a lag correlation with summer precipitation in several remote regions, but current global land–atmosphere coupled models are unable to represent this behavior due to significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures. The land’s role in the climate system at various scales has been the subject of much research since the 1970s. A few land surface attributes, such as albedo, soil moisture, leaf area index, vegetation, and aerosols in snow have been extensively investigated to explore their roles in land–atmosphere interactions. Ocean state is well known to play a major role in modulating Earth’s climate. The linkage of hydrological events to sea surface temperature (SST) anomalies, such as El Niño and La Niña, has been used to predict climate events with useful skill at long lead times ranging from a few months to a few years. However, studies have also consistently shown that the SST only partially explains climate predictability. Recent preliminary studies based on observational data and modeling have indicated that spring land temperature in the Rocky Mountains and the Tibetan Plateau (TP) could affect summer drought/flood in their respective downstream regions with a magnitude comparable to the SST effect and atmospheric internal variability. Although land surface 2-m air temperature (T2m) measurements have the best quality and longest record among various land surface variables with global coverage, their application in land–atmosphere interaction studies, S2S prediction in particular, has largely been overlooked.
research objective: To address these issues, the Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program launched the “Impact of Initialized Land Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal-to-Seasonal Prediction” (LS4P) initiative as a community effort to test the impact of land temperature in high-mountain regions on S2S prediction by climate models. This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here. The LS4P objective is to examine whether the observed cold May 2003 TP anomaly causes the observed remote June precipitation anomalies over hotspots worldwide.
challenges: Robust land initialization and model configuration are critical to this effort yet remain scientifically challenging. Most studies of land–atmosphere interactions have been limited by a lack of observational data and tend to focus on local feedbacks. Current state-of-the-art ESMs are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized LST anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. There are two issues that need further investigation: 1) The ensemble-mean-produced T2m difference is smaller than the observed anomaly. Would this deficiency cause an underestimation of the TP T2m effect? 2) In some areas, the ensemble mean produces a significant June precipitation difference, such as in western Australia and western Europe, but with the opposite sign compared to the observation. Is this due to a model deficiency in its ability to produce the full TP T2m anomaly and/or correct precipitation anomaly, and/or some other processes involved?
methods: In this study, observed T2m records are used to examine possible relationships between the TP T2m and global precipitation and to identify the locations (hotspots) where the initialization of TP May land temperatures may enhance June precipitation prediction skill. Two pairs of experiments with 16 state-of-the-art LS4P ESMs (Table ES1) have been conducted. In the first experiment (referred to as control run), we evaluate whether the ESMs can properly produce the observed TP T2m anomaly in May 2003 and the June precipitation anomaly. To alleviate the ESMs’ May TP T2m bias and to generate the observed cold TP spring anomaly, we introduce an innovative approach to initializing the LST/SUBT over the TP. After adjusting the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly over the TP, a second experiment (referred to as the sensitivity run) is conducted using the new LST/SUBT initial condition for each model over the TP, with all other initial and boundary conditions and ensemble members identical to the first experiment.
dataset: In this study, the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) T2m data, which consist in 80 stations over the TP and more than 2,400 stations over all of China, are used over China. The Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) T2m data are used elsewhere. The Climate Research Unit (CRU) data are used for precipitation over globe.
findings: This study reveals for the first time that high-mountain land temperature could be a substantial source of S2S precipitation predictability, and its effect is probably as large as ocean surface temperature over global “hotspot” regions identified here; the ensemble means in some “hotspots” produce more than 40% of the observed anomalies. Consistent results from observations and multiple ESM experiments show that improving the May TP land temperature simulation through LST/SUBT initialization over the TP allows ESMs to better predict June precipitation over hotspots, and that the LST over high-mountain areas could be a new source of S2S predictability through elevated heating.
backgroundCn: 亚季节到季节（S2S）降水预测在北半球春季和夏季月份中，尽管包括大量高影响事件，如干旱/洪水，但多年来预测效果仍然较差。青藏 Plateau（TP）春季观测的地表温度与多个远程地区的夏季降水存在滞后相关性，但当前全球陆气耦合模型由于在产生观测到的TP地表温度方面存在显著误差，无法表现出这种行为。自1970年代以来，土地在气候系统中不同尺度的作用一直是许多研究的主题。一些土地表面属性，如反照率、土壤湿度、叶面积指数、植被和雪中的气溶胶，已被广泛研究以探讨它们在陆气相互作用中的作用。海洋状态众所周知在调节地球气候方面发挥着重要作用。水文事件与海表温度（SST）异常（如厄尔尼诺和拉尼娜）的联系已被用于预测气候事件，具有从几个月到几年的有用技能。然而，研究也一致表明，SST仅部分解释气候可预测性。基于观测数据和建模的近期初步研究表明，落基山脉和青藏高原（TP）的春季地面温度可能影响各自下游地区的夏季干旱/洪水，其影响程度与SST效应和大气内部变率相当。尽管地表2米气温（T2m）测量在各种陆地表面变量中具有最佳质量和最长记录，并且具有全球覆盖，但它们在陆气相互作用研究中的应用，特别是在S2S预测中，仍然被大大忽视。
research objectiveCn: 为了解决这些问题，全球能源与水交换（GEWEX）计划启动了“初始化的陆地温度和雪盖对亚季节到季节预测的影响”（LS4P）倡议，作为一项社区努力，测试高山地区的陆地温度对气候模型的S2S预测的影响。这项研究首次揭示，高山陆地温度可能是S2S降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”地区的海洋表面温度相当。LS4P的目标是检验2003年5月观察到的青藏高原冷异常是否导致全球热点地区6月降水异常的出现。
challengesCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置对这一努力至关重要，但仍然在科学上具有挑战性。大多数关于陆地-大气相互作用的研究受到观测数据不足的限制，通常集中于局部反馈。目前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，原因在于模型参数化和提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据存在缺陷。有两个问题需要进一步研究：1）集合均值产生的2米气温（T2m）差异小于观测异常。这一缺陷是否会导致对热带气候（TP）T2m效应的低估？2）在某些地区，集合均值产生了显著的6月降水差异，例如在西澳大利亚和西欧，但与观测结果的符号相反。这是否由于模型在产生完整的TP T2m异常和/或正确的降水异常方面的缺陷，和/或涉及其他过程？
methodsCn: 在这项研究中，观察到的T2m记录用于检查TP T2m与全球降水之间的可能关系，并识别出初始化TP 5月地面温度可能增强6月降水预测技能的位置（热点）。进行了两组实验，使用16个最先进的LS4P ESMs（见表ES1）。在第一个实验（称为控制运行）中，我们评估ESMs是否能够正确产生2003年5月的TP T2m异常和6月的降水异常。为了减轻ESMs在5月TP T2m上的偏差，并生成观察到的寒冷TP春季异常，我们引入了一种创新的方法来初始化TP的LST/SUBT。在根据每个模型的T2m偏差和TP的观察异常调整LST/SUBT初始条件后，进行了第二个实验（称为敏感性运行），该实验使用新的TP LST/SUBT初始条件，所有其他初始和边界条件以及集合成员与第一个实验相同。
datasetCn: 在本研究中，使用了中国气象局（CMA）的T2m数据，该数据涵盖了青藏高原的80个站点以及中国境内超过2400个站点。气候异常监测系统（CAMS）的T2m数据用于其他地区。气候研究单位（CRU）的数据用于全球降水。
findingsCn: 这项研究首次揭示，高山地区的地面温度可能是季节到季节（S2S）降水可预测性的一个重要来源，其影响可能与全球“热点”区域的海洋表面温度相当；在一些“热点”区域，集合均值产生的观测异常超过40%。来自观测和多种地球系统模型（ESM）实验的一致结果表明，通过对青藏 Plateau（TP）地区的地面温度进行LST/SUBT初始化，改善5月份的地面温度模拟，可以使ESM更好地预测6月份在热点地区的降水，而高山地区的地面温度可能成为通过升高加热提供S2S可预测性的一个新来源。

background: The successful prediction of droughts and floods at subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) time scales is one of the major challenges of weather and climate prediction, with failures that can result in major adverse impacts on societies and economies. Improving the prediction skill at S2S timescale requires a further understanding of the mechanisms at work for climate variabilities at this timescale as well as the identification of predictability sources. Recent studies suggest that springtime land surface/subsurface temperature (LST/SUBT) provides a new source of predictability at S2S time scales. The Global Energy and Water Exchanges (GEWEX) program has initiated the project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” to investigate the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions.
research objective: The project “Impact of Initialized Land Surface Temperature and Snowpack on Subseasonal to Seasonal Prediction (LS4P)” was initiated to study the impact of springtime LST/SUBT anomalies over high mountain areas on summertime precipitation predictions. The present work explores the simulated global scale response of the atmospheric circulation to the springtime TP land surface cooling by 16 current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) participating in the LS4P Phase I (LS4P-I) experiment.
challenges: The participant models that fail in capturing the TRC wave train greatly under-predict climate anomalies in reference to observations and the successful models. However, the simulated propagation pathways from the TP into the Southern Hemisphere show large inter-model differences.
methods: In the first phase of the LS4P project (LS4P-I), the year 2003 is the focal case, in which extreme summer drought/flood occurred in East Asia after a very cold spring in the TP. Two sets of numerical experiments were conducted in LS4P-I to investigate the global influence of the TP spring surface temperature anomaly. A first set of runs, referred to as EXP_CTRL, is designed to evaluate the performance of the 16 ESMs in simulating the TP T2m and precipitation anomalies during May and June 2003. In EXP_CTRL runs, the ESMs start simulations from late April or May 1st, and use the standard S2S prediction setting of atmospheric and land initial conditions. Another set of numerical experiments was carried out by the ESMs to test whether the regional bias in June precipitation mentioned in the previous paragraph is related to the bias in May surface temperature over TP. In this set of experiments, which are collectively referred to as EXP_LST/SUBT run, the models’ bias in May TP T2m is reduced by initializing the TP LST and SUBT conditions.
dataset: The observed T2m anomaly in the TP is shown in Fig. 1a, for which we use the data from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS, Fan and van den Dool 2008). We use the fifth generation ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis (ERA5, Hersbach et al. 2020), which is referred to as observations, with a regular horizontal resolution of 1.0° × 1.0° to investigate the atmospheric circulation in year 2003 and for climatology, with the latter defined as the average from year 1981 to 2015. The global precipitation data are from the Climate Research Unit (CRU), in which version 4.02 is used when implementing the analysis.
findings: The LS4P-I results show, for the first time, that springtime TP surface anomalies can modulate a persistent quasi-barotropic Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal (TRC) wave train from the TP via the northeast Asia and Bering Strait to the western part of the North America, along with the springtime westerly jet from TP across the whole North Pacific basin. These results suggest that the TP LST/SUBT anomaly via the TRC wave train is the first order source of the S2S variability in the regions mentioned. Furthermore, the TP surface temperature anomaly can influence the Southern Hemispheric circulation by generating cross-equator wave trains.

methodsCn: 在LS4P项目的第一阶段（LS4P-I）中，2003年是重点案例，该年东亚经历了极端的夏季干旱/洪水，春季在青藏 Plateau（TP）则经历了非常寒冷的天气。LS4P-I中进行了两组数值实验，以研究TP春季表面温度异常的全球影响。第一组实验称为EXP_CTRL，旨在评估16个地球系统模型（ESMs）在模拟2003年5月和6月TP气温（T2m）和降水异常方面的表现。在EXP_CTRL实验中，ESMs从4月底或5月1日开始模拟，并使用标准的季节到季节（S2S）预测设置的气候和陆地初始条件。另一组数值实验则由ESMs进行，以测试6月降水的区域偏差是否与TP 5月表面温度的偏差相关。在这一组实验中，统称为EXP_LST/SUBT运行，通过初始化TP的陆地表面温度（LST）和土壤温度（SUBT）条件，减少模型在5月TP T2m上的偏差。

findingsCn: LS4P-I的结果首次表明，春季的温度异常可以通过持久的准纬向青藏 Plateau-落基山脉环全球(TRC)波列，从青藏 Plateau 传播到东北亚和白令海峡，再到北美西部，同时影响整个北太平洋盆地的春季西风急流。这些结果表明，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度/土壤湿度异常通过 TRC 波列是上述地区季节到季节变率的主要来源。此外，青藏 Plateau 的地表温度异常还可以通过产生跨赤道波列影响南半球的环流。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge faced when modeling the subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictability of weather events due to land surface temperature anomalies?
Example.QuestionCn: 一个由于地表温度异常而在建模季节内到季节间（S2S）天气事件可预测性时面临的挑战的例子是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: One challenge in modeling S2S predictability is that current state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) are unable to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature (LST) anomalies, which is due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and in the reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions.
Example.AnswerCn: 在建模季节到季节的可预测性时，一个挑战是当前最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留从初始化的陆面温度（LST）异常中获得的记忆，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及提供不平衡初始大气/陆地条件的再分析数据。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the role of 'global atmospheric circulation response' in understanding S2S prediction challenges?
Definition.QuestionCn: “全球大气环流响应”在理解季节到季节（S2S）预测挑战中的作用是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'global atmospheric circulation response' plays a crucial role in understanding the challenges of subseasonal to seasonal (S2S) prediction by illustrating how anomalies, such as those in the land surface temperature of the Tibetan Plateau, can propagate and influence weather patterns across various regions. The response involves complex interactions, such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal wave train, which can affect precipitation and temperature patterns in remote areas. Examining these responses helps identify predictability sources and improve model simulations, although challenges remain due to inter-model differences and biases in reproducing such responses accurately.
Definition.AnswerCn: “全球大气环流响应”在理解亚季节到季节（S2S）预测的挑战中发挥着至关重要的作用，它展示了诸如青藏高原的陆地表面温度异常如何传播并影响各个地区的天气模式。该响应涉及复杂的相互作用，例如青藏高原-落基山脉的全球波列，这可能影响偏远地区的降水和温度模式。研究这些响应有助于识别可预测性来源并改善模型模拟，尽管由于模型间差异和在准确再现这些响应方面的偏差，仍然存在挑战。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using observed land temperature data for initializing climate models compared to using reanalysis data for the same purpose?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用观测地面温度数据初始化气候模型与使用再分析数据初始化气候模型时面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Using observed land temperature data for initializing climate models presents challenges related to the lack of robust land initialization and model configuration, with significant errors in producing observed surface temperatures. This is contrasted with reanalysis data, which often provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions due to deficiencies in model parameterizations. Both approaches struggle with preserving memory from initialized anomalies, but observed data can highlight specific biases like the TP surface temperature anomaly, which reanalysis data might not capture accurately.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用观测的陆地温度数据来初始化气候模型面临着与缺乏稳健的陆地初始化和模型配置相关的挑战，这导致在生成观测到的表面温度时出现显著误差。这与再分析数据形成对比，再分析数据通常由于模型参数化的缺陷而提供不平衡的初始大气/陆地条件。这两种方法都在保持初始化异常的记忆方面存在困难，但观测数据可以突出特定的偏差，例如青藏高原表面温度异常，而再分析数据可能无法准确捕捉到这一点。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature data enhance the prediction of seasonal precipitation patterns in high-mountain regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 如何初始化地表温度和地下温度数据以增强高山地区季节性降水模式的预测能力？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high-mountain regions, such as the Tibetan Plateau, can improve the prediction of seasonal precipitation patterns by reducing model bias in temperature anomalies. This enhancement allows Earth System Models to better simulate the observed anomalies and predict precipitation more accurately over global hotspots, as demonstrated in the LS4P initiative.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度和地下温度的初始化可以通过减少温度异常的模型偏差来改善季节性降水模式的预测。这种增强使得地球系统模型能够更好地模拟观察到的异常，并更准确地预测全球热点地区的降水，正如LS4P倡议所展示的那样。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges do researchers face in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies in Earth System Models, and how might these be addressed?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 研究人员在保存地球系统模型中初始化的陆地表面温度异常记忆方面面临哪些挑战，以及如何解决这些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: Researchers face challenges in preserving the memory of initialized land surface temperature anomalies due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions provided by reanalysis data. Addressing these challenges involves improving model configurations and robust land initialization techniques to ensure that the models can accurately simulate and maintain the desired temperature anomalies.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 研究人员在保存初始化地表温度异常的记忆方面面临挑战，这主要是由于模型参数化的不足以及再分析数据提供的不平衡初始大气/陆地条件。解决这些挑战需要改进模型配置和稳健的陆地初始化技术，以确保模型能够准确模拟和维持所需的温度异常。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What role does the Tibetan Plateau play in influencing global atmospheric circulation patterns, and how can datasets be utilized to explore this impact?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 青藏高原在影响全球大气环流模式中扮演着什么角色，如何利用数据集来探讨这一影响？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The Tibetan Plateau plays a significant role in influencing global atmospheric circulation patterns by modulating wave trains, such as the Tibetan Plateau-Rocky Mountain Circumglobal wave train. Datasets like the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's Climate Anomaly Monitoring System and ECMWF atmospheric reanalysis can be utilized to observe and analyze these circulation responses, helping to identify the plateau's impact on climate variability and predictability at subseasonal-to-seasonal timescales.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 青藏高原在影响全球大气环流模式方面发挥着重要作用，通过调节波列，如青藏高原-落基山脉环全球波列。可以利用国家海洋和大气管理局的气候异常监测系统和欧洲中期天气预报中心的大气再分析数据集来观察和分析这些环流响应，帮助识别高原对气候变异性和可预测性的影响，尤其是在亚季节到季节的时间尺度上。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes the challenges in ensuring robust land initialization and model configuration for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 确保亚季节到季节预测的土地初始化和模型配置稳健性面临的挑战是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Challenges in robust land initialization and model configuration stem from deficiencies in model parameterizations and reanalysis data that provide unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions. Additionally, the inability of state-of-the-art Earth System Models (ESMs) to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature (LST) anomalies contributes to these challenges.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 稳健的土地初始化和模型配置面临的挑战源于模型参数化和再分析数据的不足，这导致初始大气/土地条件不平衡。此外，最先进的地球系统模型（ESMs）无法完全保留初始化的地表温度（LST）异常的记忆，这也加剧了这些挑战。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the significant inter-model differences observed in the simulated propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致从青藏高原向南半球传播路径的模拟中观察到显著模型间差异的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The inter-model differences in simulated propagation pathways are influenced by large variability in model responses, particularly in Southern Hemisphere circulations. This inconsistency with observations is possibly due to varying model parameterizations and biases in the representation of atmospheric dynamics and land-atmosphere interactions.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 模拟传播路径的模型间差异受到模型响应的大变异性的影响，特别是在南半球环流方面。这种与观测不一致的情况可能是由于模型参数化的差异以及在大气动力学和陆气相互作用表示中的偏差所致。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why do current global land-atmosphere coupled models struggle to represent observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperature behavior and its impact on remote precipitation?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型为何难以再现观察到的青藏高原表面温度变化及其对远程降水的影响？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Global land-atmosphere coupled models face difficulties in representing observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperature behavior due to significant errors in producing observed temperatures. This is potentially caused by inadequate model parameterizations and the lack of integration of land surface attributes such as soil moisture and vegetation, which impact land-atmosphere interactions and precipitation prediction.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 全球陆气耦合模型在再现观察到的青藏高原表面温度行为方面面临困难，因为在产生观察到的温度时存在显著误差。这可能是由于模型参数化不足以及缺乏对土壤湿度和植被等陆面属性的整合，这些因素影响了陆气相互作用和降水预测。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of using initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data on subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据对亚季节到季节预测准确性的潜在影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Utilizing initialized land surface temperature and snowpack data can enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction accuracy by revealing high-mountain land temperature as a substantial source of precipitation predictability. This approach can improve model performance by better aligning with observed anomalies, particularly in hotspot regions, thus increasing the reliability of predictions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 利用初始化的地表温度和雪盖数据可以提高亚季节到季节预测的准确性，因为它揭示了高山地区的土地温度是降水可预测性的一个重要来源。这种方法可以通过更好地与观察到的异常对齐，从而提高模型性能，特别是在热点区域，从而增加预测的可靠性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the outcomes of integrating multiple Earth System Models in exploring the global atmospheric response to Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合多个地球系统模型以探索青藏 Plateau 表面异常对全球大气反应的结果可能是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple Earth System Models can provide a comprehensive understanding of the global atmospheric response to Tibetan Plateau surface anomalies. It allows for the assessment of diverse model performances, identifying common patterns such as the TRC wave train, and understanding inter-model variability, which can enhance the robustness of subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多个地球系统模型可以全面理解青藏 Plateau 表面异常对全球大气的响应。这使得评估不同模型的表现成为可能，识别出诸如 TRC 波列等共同模式，并理解模型间的变异性，从而增强亚季节到季节预测的可靠性。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures could be implemented to enhance the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high-mountain regions for better subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 可以实施哪些程序来增强高山地区地表温度和地下温度的初始化，以改善亚季节到季节的预测？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: To enhance the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high-mountain regions, one innovative approach is to adjust the LST/SUBT initial conditions based on each model's T2m bias and observed anomaly over the Tibetan Plateau. This involves conducting sensitivity runs where the initial conditions are tailored to reduce the models' bias, which in turn can improve prediction skill for downstream effects such as precipitation anomalies.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 为了增强高山地区地表温度和地下温度的初始化，一种创新的方法是根据每个模型的2米温度偏差和青藏 Plateau的观测异常来调整地表温度/地下温度的初始条件。这涉及进行敏感性试验，其中初始条件经过调整以减少模型的偏差，从而改善对下游效应（如降水异常）的预测能力。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can numerical experiments be structured to assess the influence of spring surface temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何构建数值实验以评估春季表面温度异常对全球降水模式的影响？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Numerical experiments can be structured by conducting two sets of runs: a control run and a sensitivity run. The control run evaluates the models' ability to simulate observed temperature and precipitation anomalies, while the sensitivity run adjusts the initial conditions to generate the observed anomalies. These experiments help to explore the influence of spring surface temperature anomalies on global precipitation patterns by comparing the outcomes and assessing improvement in prediction skill.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数值实验可以通过进行两组实验来结构化：控制实验和敏感性实验。控制实验评估模型模拟观测到的温度和降水异常的能力，而敏感性实验则调整初始条件以生成观测到的异常。这些实验有助于通过比较结果和评估预测技能的改善，探索春季表面温度异常对全球降水模式的影响。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature conditions for improved S2S prediction?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以初始化地表温度和地下温度条件，以改善季节到季节的预测？
Enablement.AnswerEn: In the LS4P project, the initialization of land surface and subsurface temperature over the Tibetan Plateau is enabled by adjusting initial conditions based on each model’s T2m bias and observed anomaly. This approach allows models to better simulate the observed temperature anomalies and enhance prediction skill.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目中，通过根据每个模型的T2m偏差和观测到的异常调整初始条件，来初始化青藏高原的地表和地下温度。这种方法使模型能够更好地模拟观测到的温度异常，并提高预测技能。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions are necessary for state-of-the-art Earth System Models to accurately simulate the impact of springtime land surface temperature anomalies on precipitation predictions?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 为了准确模拟春季地表温度异常对降水预测的影响，最先进的地球系统模型需要满足哪些条件？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Accurate simulation requires robust initialization of land surface conditions, proper model configuration, and reduction of biases in temperature anomalies. These conditions are necessary to capture the influence of the Tibetan Plateau's surface temperature anomalies on global atmospheric circulation and subsequent precipitation predictions.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 准确的模拟需要对陆地表面条件进行稳健的初始化、适当的模型配置以及减少温度异常的偏差。这些条件对于捕捉青藏高原表面温度异常对全球大气环流及后续降水预测的影响是必要的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why do current global land–atmosphere coupled models struggle to accurately represent the observed Tibetan Plateau surface temperatures?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型为何难以准确表示观察到的青藏 Plateau 表面温度？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Current global land–atmosphere coupled models have significant errors in producing observed TP surface temperatures due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and imbalances in the initial atmospheric/land conditions provided by reanalysis data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 当前全球陆气耦合模型在产生观测到的热带地区表面温度方面存在显著误差，这主要是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及由再分析数据提供的初始大气/陆地条件的不平衡所致。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the potential reasons for the inconsistencies between simulated and observed atmospheric responses in the Southern Hemisphere?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 南半球模拟和观测大气响应之间不一致的潜在原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The inconsistencies between simulated and observed atmospheric responses in the Southern Hemisphere could be due to large inter-model differences in the simulated propagation pathways from the TP, as well as differences in the phase and speed of the wave train compared to observations.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 南半球模拟和观测大气响应之间的不一致可能是由于模型间在从热带地区传播路径上的巨大差异，以及与观测相比波列的相位和速度差异所导致的。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the initialization of land surface/subsurface temperature anomalies be critical for enhancing subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction skill?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 土地表面/地下温度异常的初始化可能对增强亚季节到季节预测技能至关重要，原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface/subsurface temperature anomalies, particularly over high-mountain regions like the Tibetan Plateau, may enhance subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction skill because it allows models to better capture the thermal state of the land, which is a potential source of predictability for precipitation in downstream hotspot regions.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 高山地区如青藏 Plateau 的地表/地下温度异常初始化可能增强亚季节到季节的预测技能，因为这使得模型能够更好地捕捉土地的热状态，而这可能是下游热点地区降水可预测性的一个来源。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How can the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over high mountain areas improve the accuracy of subseasonal-to-seasonal predictions in terms of data collection methods?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何通过数据收集方法改善高山地区地表温度和地下温度的初始化，以提高次季节到季节预测的准确性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The initialization of land surface temperature (LST) and subsurface temperature (SUBT) over high mountain areas, such as the Tibetan Plateau, is crucial for improving subseasonal-to-seasonal (S2S) predictions. This approach allows Earth System Models (ESMs) to better simulate the observed temperature anomalies and predict precipitation anomalies, enhancing prediction skills by addressing biases related to initial temperature conditions.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 高山地区（如青藏 Plateau）的地表温度（LST）和地下温度（SUBT）的初始化对于提高亚季节到季节（S2S）预测至关重要。这种方法使地球系统模型（ESMs）能够更好地模拟观察到的温度异常并预测降水异常，通过解决与初始温度条件相关的偏差，从而增强预测技能。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't make sense of the challenges faced in accurately modeling the Tibetan Plateau's impact on global atmospheric circulations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法理解准确建模青藏高原对全球大气环流影响所面临的挑战。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges include inter-model differences in simulating the propagation pathways from the Tibetan Plateau into the Southern Hemisphere and the inability to fully capture the TRC wave train. These discrepancies arise due to model biases, inaccuracies in initial conditions, and parameterization issues, leading to inconsistencies between model simulations and observed atmospheric responses.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 挑战包括模型之间在模拟从青藏 Plateau 向南半球传播路径方面的差异，以及无法完全捕捉到 TRC 波列。这些差异源于模型偏差、初始条件的不准确性和参数化问题，导致模型模拟与观测到的大气响应之间的不一致。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential data collection methods for monitoring springtime land surface and subsurface temperature anomalies over high mountain areas, specifically focusing on the Tibetan Plateau.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨监测高山地区（特别是青藏高原）春季地表和地下温度异常的潜在数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: In the context of the LS4P project, observed T2m records from the Chinese Meteorological Administration (CMA) and the Climate Anomaly Monitoring System (CAMS) are used to examine the relationships between the Tibetan Plateau T2m and global precipitation. Additionally, the initialization of land surface temperature and subsurface temperature over the Tibetan Plateau is approached by adjusting initial conditions based on model biases and observed anomalies.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在LS4P项目的背景下，使用中国气象局（CMA）和气候异常监测系统（CAMS）观测到的T2m记录来研究青藏高原T2m与全球降水之间的关系。此外，通过根据模型偏差和观测异常调整初始条件，来初始化青藏高原的地表温度和地下温度。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges faced in data collection and model initialization for subseasonal-to-seasonal prediction models and suggest potential improvements.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析在亚季节到季节预测模型中数据收集和模型初始化面临的挑战，并提出潜在的改进建议。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One of the challenges in data collection and model initialization is the inability of current Earth System Models (ESMs) to fully preserve the memory from initialized land surface temperature anomalies. This is due to deficiencies in model parameterizations and unbalanced initial atmospheric/land conditions provided by reanalysis data. Potential improvements could involve more robust land initialization techniques and addressing model biases to enhance the accuracy of predictions.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在数据收集和模型初始化中，当前的地球系统模型（ESMs）面临的一个挑战是无法完全保留初始化的陆地表面温度异常的记忆。这是由于模型参数化的缺陷以及再分析数据提供的不平衡的初始大气/陆地条件所导致的。潜在的改进可以涉及更强大的陆地初始化技术以及解决模型偏差，以提高预测的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify potential datasets that could be utilized to enhance the understanding and prediction of subseasonal-to-seasonal climatic events, particularly those related to the Tibetan Plateau.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别潜在的数据集，这些数据集可以用于增强对亚季节到季节气候事件的理解和预测，特别是与青藏 Plateau 相关的事件。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Potential datasets that could enhance prediction capabilities include the ERA5 reanalysis data from ECMWF for atmospheric circulation analysis, NOAA's Climate Anomaly Monitoring System for T2m anomaly detection, and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) data for global precipitation analysis. These datasets can provide comprehensive insights into atmospheric and climatic conditions relevant to the Tibetan Plateau.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 潜在的数据集可以增强预测能力，包括来自欧洲中期天气预报中心（ECMWF）的ERA5再分析数据，用于大气环流分析；美国国家海洋和大气管理局（NOAA）的气候异常监测系统，用于气温异常检测；以及气候研究单位（CRU）数据，用于全球降水分析。这些数据集可以提供与青藏高原相关的大气和气候条件的全面洞察。
